definition: lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie

sentences.chinese: “那還用說，”理髮師斬釘截鐵地說。

sentences.english: The answer in Southeast Asia is definitely "yes".
sentences.chinese: 在東南亞，答案是斬釘截鐵的“是”。

sentences.english: I said that the beverage is three long pants, they categorically said no.
sentences.chinese: 我說的是褲長三尺三，人家斬釘截鐵地說沒有。
“去掉獨角獸，”我斬釘截鐵的說。

sentences.english: He answered the other side's questions categorically.
sentences.chinese: 他斬釘截鐵地回答對方的問題。

sentences.english: The definiteness of the man chilled him to the marrow .
sentences.chinese: 這人斬釘截鐵的口吻使他冷徹骨髓。

to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
resolute/definitive/categorically/absolutely
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
direct and plainspoken (idiom); blunt/straightforward
to remain unmoved
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to dispute/to refute
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
evidence
a lie/untrue statement/misstatement
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through

gossip/hearsay/rumor
